name: unprosperous
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
not successful, especially not earning much money: He plays the dedicated, but unprosperous proprietor of a specialist record store. They lived in an unprosperous neighbourhood. Opposite
prosperous
More examplesFewer examplesShe was born into a large, unprosperous farming family.The houses were built on the edge of the village for its then not unprosperous blue-collar workers. The relatively poor and unproductive agricultural lands kept regional landowners widely dispersed and relatively unprosperous. For all the talk of wealth, he describes the city as strangely unprosperous.
